intro: Schmidelia affinis, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and are borne in dense clusters along the stems. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is adapted to drought conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
